item.title: Analyzing long win streaks in online chess
item.description: I’ve conducted a simple analysis using Elo win probability estimation and Monte-Carlo simulation to estimate the likelihood of Hikaru Nakamura achieving long win streaks, such as the one recently highlighted by Vladimir Kramnik. My findings suggest these streaks are not statistical anomalies indicative of cheating and are likely over an extended period (e.g., a year). See Monte-Carlo simulation tables and conclusion below. This post doesn’t aim to determine whether Hikaru Nakamura or other players have engaged in cheating.
